Description: Three beads made in different shapes and materials. A: One elongated spherical bead made of vivid turquoise glass, the shape is somewhat irregular. B: One flattened spherical bead with an edge running around its outer surface, made of vivid turquoise faience. C: One segmented cylindrical bead, six segments fully preserved, made of vivid turquoise faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), F5.3, pottery pit
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
